results.abstract: V Schwenk dismissed as gen mgr of New Orleans Saints; speculation that former astronaut D Gordon might succeed him

headline.main: Saints Dismiss Schwenk; Ex-Astronaut May Get Job

results.snippet: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 9 (AP) -- Vic Schwenk was dismissed today as general manager of the New Orleans Saints and a former astronaut, Dick Gordon, was among those mentioned as a possible replacement for him.
results.lead_paragraph: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 9 (AP) -- Vic Schwenk was dismissed today as general manager of the New Orleans Saints and a former astronaut, Dick Gordon, was among those mentioned as a possible replacement for him.

headline.main: Rocket for Apollo 16 Moon Mission Is Moved to Pad

results.snippet: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Dec. 13 (UPI) -- Thomas K. Mattingly 2d watched the next to last moon rocket move to its oceanside launching pad today and said the space program was just beginning.
results.lead_paragraph: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Dec. 13 (UPI) -- Thomas K. Mattingly 2d watched the next to last moon rocket move to its oceanside launching pad today and said the space program was just beginning.

results.abstract: 45,000-ton Cosmonaut Yuri Gagarin, USSR ship designed to aid in high-alt research and spacecraft control, unveiled; is equipped with 4 large dish antennas; facilities described

headline.main: RUSSIANS EXPAND SPACE TRACKING; New Ship, Luxury Liner Size, Is Unveiled in Odessa

results.snippet: MOSCOW, Dec. 13--The Soviet Union unveiled this weekend its latest and largest space tracking ship, the 45,000-ton Cosmonaut Yuri Gagarin, which represents a significant addition to the Russians' deep space communications network.

byline.original: By THEODORE SHABADSpecial to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW, Dec. 13--The Soviet Union unveiled this weekend its latest and largest space tracking ship, the 45,000-ton Cosmonaut Yuri Gagarin, which represents a significant addition to the Russians' deep space communications network.

byline.original: By DOUGLAS E. KNEELANDSpecial to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: PALO ALTO, Calif., Dec. 15 -- Riding the waves of confrontations and crises that have swept the country in the last few years, the lecture circuit has become big business, with millions of dollars worth of annual bookings and top performers earning six-figure salaries.

headline.main: Gift for Green Thumbs: 1,200 Live Ladybugs

results.snippet: How would you like to wake up on Christmas morning and find that someone had sent you 1,200 live ladybugs? Beats that business about the partridge in the pear tree and all its concomitants, doesn't it?
results.lead_paragraph: How would you like to wake up on Christmas morning and find that someone had sent you 1,200 live ladybugs? Beats that business about the partridge in the pear tree and all its concomitants, doesn't it?
